resources.string: Application will respond only if number is in your contacts list.
Application will not care if number is in your contacts list or not.
Application will respond only if number is coming from your country.
Application will not care if number is foreign or not.

After sending one autoresponse to given number, application will wait with autoresponding to this number until you will send SMS/make call to this number. Caution: Enabling this option on Samsung or if you have custom dialer/SMS app can make application not responding at all.
Application will not limit autoresponses per number.

If you will choose any of listed contacts groups, this list will become whitelist (all numbers which aren\'t in that group will not receive any automatical response). You can only choose groups which contains at least one contact.

If you will choose any of listed contact groups, this list will become blacklist (all numbers which are in this group will not receive any automatical response). You can only choose groups which contains at least one contact.

If you will choose any of listed contact groups, this list will become whitelist (all numbers which aren\'t in that group will not receive any automatical response). You can only choose groups which contains at least one contact.
Your mobile device can\'t read your actual number from SIM card. For preventing responding to your own number (for example, when voice mail call you), please put here your phone number.
After sending one autoresponse to given number, until this time will pass, application will not automatically respond to given number.

Choose desired way of preventing of sending too much autoresponses. One method is not autoresponding again until you will contact given number, another is having time delay between autoresponses. This functionality can be also disabled.
